title: Class AA rankings breakdown: Week 7
text:
Defeated Lincoln 46-14. Previously not ranked. 
Honorable Mention: Loyalsock Township (6-0),Karns City (6-0), Highlands (6-0), Steel Valley (5-1), Seton LaSalle (5-1) 
South Fayette (6-0) - In what was supposed to be somewhat of a challenge, South Fayette had no problem beating Steel Valley 37-0. The Lions won their 38th game in a row. Running back Hunter Hayes rushed 26 times for 160 yards and two touchdowns. They'll take on Sto-Rox this week at home. Aliquippa - (6-0) - Aliquippa took it to Beaver Area, defeating them by a 52-7 score. They'll take on a Freedom Area team looking to win their second game of the year. Wyomissing Area-(6-0) - Wymossing defeated Kutztown 64-14 last week. Wyomissing scored 51 points in the first half. Alrighty then. They'll take on Fleetwood on the road this week. Berks Catholic (6-0) - Berks Catholic rolled to their sixth victory of the year with a 48-14 win over Schuylkill Valley. They'll take on Hamburg on the road this week. Southern Columbia (6-0) - Southern Columbia pitched a shut-out against Mt. Carmel, winning 42-0. Sharon (5-1) - Sharon defeated Grove City 35-6. They'll travel to Northwestern this weekend. Washington (6-0) - Washington gave it to Charleroi, defeating them 67-8. Could we have them ranked too low? It's possible. Running back Kurt Adkins ran for 166 yards and three touchdowns. They'll face New Brighton on the road this week. Hickory (5-1) - The Hornets rolled over previously undefeated Greenville 28-9. Running back Chuck Carr ran 24 times for 151 yards and one touchdown. Their next game is against Northwestern on the road. Bedford (6-0) - The Bisons took out Bishop McCort with ease, defeating them 42-0. Next up for the Bisons is Richland Township in an away game. Beaver Falls (6-0) - Beaver Falls enters our top then for the first time this year as they defeated Lincoln 46-14. Quaker Valley comes to town this week.
